subs.1.1 Listening Skills: Child's ability to listen attentively and comprehend spoken language, including following instructions and responding appropriately.
subs.1.2 Speaking Skills: Child's expressive language skills, including vocabulary, sentence structure, and clarity of speech.
subs.1.3 Reading Readiness: Child’s pre-reading skills, such as letter recognition, phonemic awareness, and understanding basic concepts of print.

subs.1.1 Number Recognition: Child's ability to recognise and name numbers.
subs.1.2 Counting Skills: Child's ability to count objects and understand the concept of one-to-one correspondence.
subs.1.3 Pattern Recognition: Child's ability to identify and create basic patterns.

subs.1.1 Critical Thinking: Child's ability to listen attentively and comprehend spoken language, including following instructions and responding appropriately.
subs.1.2 Problem-Solving Strategies: How well the child approaches and solves problems, considering different strategies and approaches.

subs.1.1 Peer Interaction: Child's ability to initiate and engage in play with peers, considering factors such as sharing, turn-taking, and cooperation.
subs.1.2 Communication Skills: Child’s verbal and nonverbal communication abilities, including the use of eye contact, facial expressions, and body language.
subs.1.3 Friendship Building: Child’s capacity to form and maintain friendships.

subs.1.1 Self-Awareness: Child's ability to recognise and label their own emotions.
subs.1.2 Self-Control: How well the child manages and controls their emotional reactions.
subs.1.3 Coping Strategies: Child's repertoire of coping mechanisms when faced with stress or adversity, including seeking help from adults, or expressing emotions through words or art.

subs.1.1 Understanding others: Child's capacity to recognise and understand the emotions of others, demonstrating empathy through supportive behaviours.
subs.1.2 Helping and Caring: Whether the child offers assistance, comfort, or support to peers, teachers, or even inanimate objects, indicating a developing sense of empathy and kindness.

subs.1.1 Locomotor Skills: Child's ability to move and control their body in different ways, including walking, running, jumping, hopping, skipping, and galloping.
subs.1.2 Balance: Child's balance while engaging in activities such as standing on one foot, walking on a straight line, or navigating obstacles.
subs.1.3 Coordination: Child's hand-eye coordination and overall body coordination.

subs.1.1 Hand and Finger Coordination: Child's ability to manipulate small objects using their hands and fingers, including tasks such as picking up small items, holding writing utensils, and using scissors.
subs.1.2 Handwriting Skills: Child’s ability to form letters, numbers, and shapes with control and precision.

subs.1.1 Interest in Learning: Child's eagerness to explore new ideas, concepts, and materials.
subs.1.2 Questioning: Child's ability to ask questions about their environment, showing curiosity about how things work and seeking information to satisfy their natural curiosity.
subs.1.3 Exploratory Play: Child's willingness to engage in exploratory play and experimenting with different materials

subs.1.1 Independence Task: Child’s ability to complete a task independently.
subs.1.2 Self-Care: Child's independence in basic self-care tasks, such as handwashing, using tissues and etc.
